meanings.definition: The act of shaking something out.
meanings.sent1: After the picnic, the mom did a shakeouts of the picnic blanket to remove the crumbs.
meanings.sent2: She gave the rug a good shakeouts to get rid of the dust.
meanings.sent3: During the laundry day, the shakeouts of the clothes made the room look like a snowstorm.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake felt like a giant shakeouts of the entire city.
meanings.sent5: The shakeouts of the tree branches in the wind created a mesmerizing dance.

meanings.definition: A period of economic decline or restructuring resulting in the elimination of weaker companies or assets.
meanings.sent1: The recent shakeouts in the stock market have caused many investors to panic.
meanings.sent2: During the recession, there were massive shakeouts in the housing market.
meanings.sent3: The shakeouts in the business world led to many layoffs and closures.
meanings.sent4: The shakeouts in the industry left only the strongest companies standing.
meanings.sent5: The shakeouts in the economy were a harsh reality for many small businesses.

meanings.definition: A process of removing unwanted or unnecessary elements from a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The shakeouts in the team helped improve efficiency and productivity.
meanings.sent2: The company underwent a shakeouts to streamline its operations.
meanings.sent3: The shakeouts of outdated policies made the organization more agile.
meanings.sent4: The shakeouts of unnecessary expenses saved the company a lot of money.
meanings.sent5: The shakeouts of unproductive employees led to a more cohesive work environment.
